meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of metagenesis.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the metagenic process in simple organisms.
meanings.sent2: The metagenic nature of the organism allowed it to adapt to various environments.
meanings.sent3: The metagenic experiment resulted in a surprising outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was metagenic, constantly evolving and changing.
meanings.sent5: The metagenic concept opened up new possibilities for research.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing different types of cells or tissues.
meanings.sent1: The metagenic cells showed remarkable versatility in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The plant's metagenic abilities enabled it to regenerate damaged parts.
meanings.sent3: The metagenic plant seemed to have a mind of its own, growing in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent4: His metagenic talent for art produced masterpieces that varied in style and form.
meanings.sent5: The metagenic properties of the material allowed for endless applications in medicine.
